original: The attention economy is a concept that analyzes the allocation of human attention as a scarce resource in an information-rich environment. Researchers Erik Brynjolfsson, Seon Tae Kim, and Joo Hee Oh have contributed to the formal analysis of this economy, particularly in valuing free goods.
